titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Royal College of Art Sketch Club Collection
Royal College of Art Sketch Club Collection
titlestmt.author: compiled by Lewis West; edited by Francis Lapka

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale Center for British Art, Rare Books and Manuscripts

address.addressline: Department of Rare Books and Manuscripts

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Monday April 29, 2019 at 21:00

did.unittitle: Royal College of Art Sketch Club Collection

repository.corpname: Yale Center for British Art, Rare Books and Manuscripts

did.physdesc: 1 box
did.abstract: The collection includes the correspondence of and with various secretaries of the Royal College of Art (RCA) Students' Group, or Sketch Club, and contains 79 letters and postcards and 11 draft letters, written between 1934 and 1937. The materials focus primarily on the group's annual exhibition, and discuss the facilities, invite prominent figures, and solicit donations and judges for special prizes. The letters' authors include, in addition to the groups' secretaries, several notable artistic and literary figures in 1930s England, such as Wyndham Lewis, Kenneth Clark, Vanessa Bell, Clive Bell, and John Gielglud.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Royal College of Art (Great Britain). Sketch Club

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Government School of Design, predecessor to the Royal College of Art, was founded in 1837. Its goal, in its earliest years, was to train students in techniques vital to improving industrial and everyday products in England; this mission would evolve in various ways under ensuing directors, and per the demands of the students themselves. By 1896, when the school was renamed the Royal College of Art, the school had assimilated the influence of the Arts and Crafts Movement and embraced a broader vision of art and design.

During the first few decades of the twentieth century, new leadership brought ever more shifts in the mission of the RCA. The painter William Rothenstein became Principal in 1920 and began to shift the school's emphasis towards the study of fine art, and the training of designers, rather than teachers. In the words of sculptor Henry Moore: "he changed the college completely." In 1935, painter Percy Jowett succeeded Rothenstein as head of the RCA, continuing an approach more interested in the cultivation of new artistic styles and methods, rather than preserving traditional techniques. It was under the post-war reorganization of Robin Darwin, however, that the RCA fully embraced fine art and became a driving force in British post-war art.

During the 1930s, The Royal College of Art Students' Group, or Sketch Club, held annual exhibitions at the Victoria & Albert Museum, displaying students' work and awarding prizes for different genres and themes. The secretaries of the group included Frank B. Mason; J. Anthony Denney, later a fashion photographer for British Vogue; Margaret Kaye, an artist who worked in textiles and stained-glass; and Evelyn Hunt, a painter.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The collection is the physical property of the Yale Center for British Art. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the Curator of Rare Books and Manuscripts.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Royal College of Art Sketch Club Collection. Yale Center for British Art, Friends of British Art.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Yale Center for British Art, Friends of British Art.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The letters are arranged alphabetically, by the name of letter authors.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection includes 79 letters and postcards, and 11 draft letters, pertaining to the Royal College of Art Students' Group, or Sketch Club, written between 1934 and 1937. The letters concern the logistics of the group's annual exhibition, held at the Victoria & Albert Museum. The correspondence consists primarily of replies to solicitations written by secretaries of the RCA. In the replies, the authors--typically individuals involved in fine art, art and literary criticism, and museums--discuss their willingness to attend the show, or to sponsor and judge prizes for different categories of artistic production.

The letters offer insight into the various media used by students at the RCA and those valued by their correspondents, and into the continuing involvement of some of the figures with artistic education. Types of prizes mentioned include those in set design, theatrical costume, painting, embroidery, notebook sketches, posters, and ceramics. Some of the correspondents also express their enthusiasm for the RCA, such as painter and author Wyndham Lewis, while others express thoughts related to artistic practice, such as theater director Nugent Monck, who stresses the importance of responding to commissions. Most letters address the logistical details of funding and judging prizes.

Victoria and Albert Museum

did.unittitle: Elizabeth Arnold letter to J. Anthony Denney
did.physdesc: 1 sheet (1 page) : typed letter, signed ; 23 x 18 cm

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Arnold, secretary to Kenneth Clark, asks about the ceremony time for the "Exhibition which Mr. Kenneth Clark is opening for the Royal College of Art Students' Group on November 16th."

controlaccess.corpname: Royal College of Art (Great Britain). Sketch Club

did.unittitle: Leigh Ashton letter to Margaret Kaye
did.physdesc: 1 sheet (1 page) : typed letter, signed ; 24 x 19 cm

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Ashton requests information on the opening and closing dates of the "Royal College of Arts Students' exhibitions," for inclusion in the V&A Museum Handbill for November.

controlaccess.corpname: Royal College of Art (Great Britain). Sketch Club
Victoria and Albert Museum

did.unittitle: Clive Bell letter to Evelyn Hunt
did.physdesc: 1 sheet (1 page) : autograph letter, signed ; 20 x 13 cm

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Bell responds to an apparent invitation to give a speech, noting: "A few not particularly well chosen paragraphs is the limit of my capacity. Will you let me know how you feel about it?" Bell includes a Parisian address where he may be reached for the next 10 days.

controlaccess.corpname: Royal College of Art (Great Britain). Sketch Club

did.unittitle: Vanessa Bell letter to Frank B. Mason
did.physdesc: 1 sheet (1 page) : autograph letter, signed ; 23 x 18 cm

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Bell accepts the invitation to "adjudicate some of the students' work" and inquires about dates.

controlaccess.corpname: Royal College of Art (Great Britain). Sketch Club

did.unittitle: Vanessa Bell letter to Evelyn Hunt
did.physdesc: 1 sheet (1 page) : autograph letter, signed ; 23 x 18 cm

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Bell apologizes for the delay in answering a previous letter, on account of illness, and references an enclosed check to be used as a prize.

controlaccess.corpname: Royal College of Art (Great Britain). Sketch Club

did.unittitle: Kenneth Clark letter to J. Anthony Denney
did.physdesc: 1 sheet (1 page) : typed letter, signed ; 24 x 19 cm

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Clark asks Denney if he might attend an exhibition prior to its opening. He also notes his name is misspelled on the invitation cards, "which does not matter except that it confuses people."

odd.head: General
odd.p: Letterhead: "National Gallery. Trafalgar Square."

controlaccess.corpname: Royal College of Art (Great Britain). Sketch Club

did.unittitle: Muriel Clayton letter to Evelyn Hunt
did.physdesc: 1 sheet (1 page) : autograph letter, signed ; 18 x 13 cm

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Clayton apologizes for delay due to a holiday in Italy, and notes her desire for the prize to be an "annual affair." She expresses a wish for it to be for embroidery.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Letterhead: "31 Courtfield Road S.W.7 Frobisher 1671"

controlaccess.subject: Embroidery
controlaccess.corpname: Royal College of Art (Great Britain). Sketch Club

did.unittitle: Samuel Courtauld (secretary to) letter to J. Anthony Denney
did.physdesc: 1 sheet (1 page) : autograph letter, signed ; 26 x 21 cm

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Courtauld's secretary thanks Denney on behalf of his employer for the invitation to officiate at the opening of the exhibition of the Royal College of Art Sketch Club but declines the offer.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Letterhead: "12, North Audley Street, W.1 Mayfair 4517"

controlaccess.corpname: Royal College of Art (Great Britain). Sketch Club

did.unittitle: J. Anthony Denney draft letter to Samuel Courtauld
did.physdesc: 1 sheet (2 pages) : autograph letter ; 26 x 20 cm

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Denney informs Courtauld of the upcoming exhibition, asks him to officiate the opening, and notes that "your patronage" would have "such great importance to the students and the college."

controlaccess.corpname: Royal College of Art (Great Britain). Sketch Club

did.unittitle: J. Anthony Denney draft letter to W. Reid Dick
did.physdesc: 1 sheet (1 page) : autograph letter, signed ; 27 x 21 cm

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Denney informs Dick of the upcoming exhibition, and recalls his awarding of the 3 guinea prize for sculpture the previous year. He asks that Dick again award the prize.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Letterhead: "Royal College of Art Sketch Club, Royal College of Art, South Kensington, S.W.7."

controlaccess.subject: Sculpture, British
controlaccess.corpname: Royal College of Art (Great Britain). Sketch Club

did.unittitle: J. Anthony Denney draft letter to Randolph Schwabe
did.physdesc: 1 sheet (1 page) : autograph letter ; 26 x 20 cm

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Denney informs Schwabe of the upcoming exhibit and recalls Schwabe's previous giving a prize for "a drawing of 'a modern shaped figure [?].'" Denney asks that Schwabe continue his support.

controlaccess.corpname: Royal College of Art (Great Britain). Sketch Club

did.unittitle: J. Anthony Denney draft letter to Hubert L. Wellington
did.physdesc: 1 sheet (2 pages) : autograph letter ; 26 x 20 cm

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Denney informs Wellington of the upcoming exhibit and reminds him of his previous two guinea prize for a painting. He asks that Wellington continue his support and invites him to the opening of the exhibition.

controlaccess.corpname: Royal College of Art (Great Britain). Sketch Club

did.unittitle: J. Anthony Denney draft letter to John Gielgud
did.physdesc: 1 sheet (1 page) : autograph letter ; 27 x 21 cm

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Denney thanks Gielgud for his offer of a "Special Prize" and assures him that "the Committee undertakes to see that sufficient entries are made by this years students," though they will notify him if the number is too small.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Letterhead: "Royal College of Art Sketch Club, Royal College of Art, South Kensington, S.W.7."

controlaccess.corpname: Royal College of Art (Great Britain). Sketch Club

did.unittitle: J. Anthony Denney draft letter to William G. Simmonds
did.physdesc: 1 sheet (2 pages) : autograph letter, signed ; 27 x 21 cm

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Denney mentions the upcoming exhibition, and thanks Simmonds for his past awarding of "a Special Prize of a guinea for the best set of notebook drawings." He asks that Simmonds continue his support for the Club. The letter also contains a large amount of marginalia, including rough text thanking an unnamed individual for agreeing to open the exhibition (probably Kenneth Clark).

odd.head: General
odd.p: Letterhead: "Royal College of Art Sketch Club, Royal College of Art, South Kensington, S.W.7."

controlaccess.corpname: Royal College of Art (Great Britain). Sketch Club

did.unittitle: J. Anthony Denney letter to Augustus John
did.physdesc: 1 sheet (1 page) : autograph letter, signed ; 29 x 22 cm

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Denney informs John of the upcoming Sketch Club exhibition and requests that he serve as adjudicator for the Etching Section.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Letterhead: "Royal College of Art Students' Group, Royal College of Art, South Kensington, S.W.7."; added above in writing: "late - Royal College of Art Sketch Club"

controlaccess.corpname: Royal College of Art (Great Britain). Sketch Club

did.unittitle: J. Anthony Denney draft letter to E.C. Gregory
did.physdesc: 1 sheet (1 page) : autograph letter ; 29 x 22 cm

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Denney thanks Gregory for offering a prize of five guineas for the exhibition on behalf of the committee, and invites him to the opening, which will be officiated by Kenneth Clarke. The final paragraph is crossed out.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Letterhead: "Royal College of Art Students' Group, Royal College of Art, South Kensington, S.W.7."

controlaccess.corpname: Royal College of Art (Great Britain). Sketch Club

did.unittitle: J. Anthony Denney draft letter to Herbert Read
did.physdesc: 1 sheet (1 page) : autograph letter, signed ; 29 x 22 cm

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Denney informs Read of when the judging of entries into the exhibition will occur, and asks whether these times work for Read and what time they might expect him.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Letterhead: "Royal College of Art Students' Group, Royal College of Art, South Kensington, S.W.7."

controlaccess.corpname: Royal College of Art (Great Britain). Sketch Club

did.unittitle: J. Anthony Denney draft letter to P. Wyndham Lewis
did.physdesc: 1 sheet (2 pages) : autograph letter ; 29 x 22 cm

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Denney asks if Lewis might write a forward to the catalogue for the exhibition, or if he might use Lewis's speech from a previous year for that purpose.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Letterhead: "Royal College of Art Students' Group, Royal College of Art, South Kensington, S.W.7."

controlaccess.corpname: Royal College of Art (Great Britain). Sketch Club

did.unittitle: W. Reid Dick letter to Frank B. Mason
did.physdesc: 1 sheet (1 page) : autograph letter, signed ; 18 x 14 cm

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Reid asks Mason to discuss in person what he would want for the Sketch Club; he admits he is "rather in the dark as to what is normal in the way of prizes for the Sketch Club."

odd.head: General
odd.p: Letterhead: 31, Grove End Road, St John's Wood, N.W.8., Tel. Maida Vale 4197

controlaccess.corpname: Royal College of Art (Great Britain). Sketch Club

did.unittitle: Campbell Dodgson letter to Evelyn Hunt
did.physdesc: 1 sheet (1 page) : autograph letter, signed ; 12 x 18 cm

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Dodgson says he will do what Hunt asked; he only needs to know "just what I have to do, and when."

odd.head: General
odd.p: Letterhead: "Burlington Fine Arts Club, 17 Savile Row, London, W.1., Telephone Regent 6432"

controlaccess.corpname: Royal College of Art (Great Britain). Sketch Club

did.unittitle: J.H. Evans letter to J. Anthony Denney (?)
did.physdesc: 1 sheet (2 pages) : autograph letter, signed ; 18 x 12 cm

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Evans asks the price of "the line engraving by B. Morray Williams [later √Årnason] entitled Time Arrested--and of her wood engraving of Thistledown." Prices--319 and 355, respectively--are listed by each work, and written in the upper left corner, in a different ink and hand. An address is written on the back, in the same hand as the prices (possibly J. Anthony Denney).

controlaccess.corpname: Royal College of Art (Great Britain). Sketch Club

did.unittitle: H. Vernon Gardner letter to Frank B. Mason
did.physdesc: 1 sheet (1 page) : autograph letter, signed ; 17 x 13 cm

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gardner says he would be pleased to judge Nugent Monck's prize for him, and discusses when he would be available to do so. In a different hand, in the bottom corner, it reads: "Later Nugent Monck withheld his prize because nobody had a design for it. And quite rightly too!"

controlaccess.corpname: Royal College of Art (Great Britain). Sketch Club

did.unittitle: John Gielgud letter to Frank B. Mason
did.physdesc: 1 sheet (1 page) : typed letter, signed ; 18 x 12 cm

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gielgud says he would be happy to offer a prize for "Theatrical Design,", but says "it is impossible for me to promise to judge, as I have no idea what work I shall be doing in the autumn" though "I shall, hope, however, to be able to see the designs this time, if I am in London and not working day and night!" Written below, in another hand, is "Good man, this Gielgud!"

controlaccess.corpname: Royal College of Art (Great Britain). Sketch Club

did.unittitle: John Gielgud letter to Frank B. Mason
did.physdesc: 1 sheet (1 page) : typed letter, signed ; 18 x 12 cm

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gielgud encloses a check for the prize amount and says he would like to attend and give the prize, if he is able. Written below, in a different hand, "judged by Mrs. Gabrielle Enthoven."

controlaccess.corpname: Royal College of Art (Great Britain). Sketch Club

did.unittitle: S. Holmes (secretary to John Gielgud) letter to unidentified recipient (probably Margaret Kaye)
did.physdesc: 1 sheet (2 pages) : autograph letter, signed ; 18 x 12 cm

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Holmes explains that Gielgud cannot make it to the exhibition to judge, but that the Committee might contact Gabrielle Enthoven instead.

controlaccess.corpname: Royal College of Art (Great Britain). Sketch Club

did.unittitle: Eric C. Gregory letter to J. Anthony Denney
did.physdesc: 1 sheet (1 page) : typed letter, signed ; 26 x 19 cm

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gregory thanks Denney for the invitation to attend the exhibition, and expresses his sympathy for the work, though regrets he cannot make any definite commitment to attending the show.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Letterhead: "Percy Lund Humphries & Co LTD, 12 Bedford Square, London WC1"

controlaccess.corpname: Royal College of Art (Great Britain). Sketch Club

did.unittitle: Eric C. Gregory letter to Margaret Kaye
did.physdesc: 1 sheet (1 page) : typed letter, signed ; 26 x 18 cm

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gregory remembers his last prize--"a booklet had to be prepared, with cover and inside, suitable in layout for the boot trade or for travel (or was it for cameras and photography?)"--and thinks about ways to broaden the conditions.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Letterhead: "Eric C. Gregory, The Country Press, Bradford. Telephone: Bradford 3408"

controlaccess.corpname: Royal College of Art (Great Britain). Sketch Club

did.unittitle: Eric C. Gregory letter to Evelyn Hunt
did.physdesc: 1 sheet (1 page) : typed letter, signed ; 26 x 18 cm

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gregory agrees to present a prize, though asks about the exact conditions, noting past response has been small. He says he is open to modifications, and suggests Hunt speak to Mr. Bawden [i.e., Edward Bawden?]. Written at the bottom, in pencil: "Gave general, book jackets."

odd.head: General
odd.p: Letterhead: "Eric C. Gregory, The Country Press, Bradford. Telephone: Bradford 3408"

controlaccess.corpname: Royal College of Art (Great Britain). Sketch Club

did.unittitle: Eric C. Gregory letter to Evelyn Hunt
did.physdesc: 1 sheet (1 page) : typed letter, signed ; 26 x 18 cm

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gregory agrees to Hunt's (unspecified) suggestion, and says she should carry out whatever is left to be done.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Letterhead: "Eric C. Gregory, The Country Press, Bradford. Telephone: Bradford 3408"

controlaccess.corpname: Royal College of Art (Great Britain). Sketch Club

did.unittitle: Eric C. Gregory letter to Evelyn Hunt
did.physdesc: 1 sheet (1 page) : typed letter, signed ; 26 x 18 cm

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gregory discusses times when he will be in London, and says he will call Hunt.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Letterhead: "Eric C. Gregory, The Country Press, Bradford. Telephone: Bradford 3408"

controlaccess.corpname: Royal College of Art (Great Britain). Sketch Club

did.unittitle: Evelyn F. Hall letter to unidentified recipient
did.physdesc: 1 sheet (1 page) : typed letter ; 14 x 21 cm

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Hall lists the officers of the "Association of Students' Sketch Clubs" and invites the recipient to submit work to the association's next exhibit in February of 1937. Written at the top of the page is: "We have nothing to do with this, but they will write every other week."

controlaccess.corpname: Royal College of Art (Great Britain). Sketch Club

did.unittitle: William Smith, Viscount Hambleden (secretary of) letter to Evelyn Hunt
did.physdesc: 1 sheet (1 page) : typed letter, signed ; 26 x 21 cm

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The letter conveys Lord Hambleden's interest in seeing the exhibition, and mentions an enclosed five guineas as a prize.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Letterhead: "31, Belgrave Square, London, S.W.1."

controlaccess.corpname: Royal College of Art (Great Britain). Sketch Club

did.unittitle: Martin Hardie letter to J. Anthony Denney
did.physdesc: 1 sheet (1 page) : typed letter, signed ; 25 x 19 cm

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Hardie agrees to give a prize for the same amount as in the previous year, and he leaves it to the Committee to decide the award will be for.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Letterhead: "Victoria & Albert Museum, South Kensington, S.W.7., Dept. of Paintings, Dept. of Engraving, Illustration, & Design"

controlaccess.corpname: Royal College of Art (Great Britain). Sketch Club

did.unittitle: George Ravensworth Hughes letter to Margaret Kaye
did.physdesc: 1 sheet (1 page) : typed letter, signed ; 26 x 21 cm

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Hughes writes that it will be difficult to get a decision on providing a prize for the exhibit this year, but that he will make an effort to see the show and discuss future possibilities then. Hand-written at the bottom: "write early - will give prize. K."

odd.head: General
odd.p: Blind-embossed seal; letterhead: "Goldsmiths' Hall, Foster Lane, Cheapside, London E.C.2. Telephone National 6036"

controlaccess.corpname: Royal College of Art (Great Britain). Sketch Club

did.unittitle: Letter from unidentified author to Joseph Jago
did.physdesc: 1 sheet (1 page) : autograph letter, signed ; 23 x 18 cm

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The author (whose signature is illegible) asks "When do you want me to select the textile to which I give my prize ‚Ä¶"

odd.head: General
odd.p: Letterhead: "The Studio. 27, Holland Park Avenue. W.11."

controlaccess.corpname: Royal College of Art (Great Britain). Sketch Club

did.unittitle: E. McKnight Kauffer letter to Frank B. Mason
did.physdesc: 1 sheet (1 page) : typed letter, signed ; 26 x 21 cm

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Kauffer informs Mason he has gotten [E.C.] Gregory's consent to donate a prize for the exhibition, and will himself present the prize. He also mentions the probable willingness of Denis Cohen to offer a prize as well. Marginalia at bottom of page in pencil, signed FBM, notes that he verified Gregory's intent to provide a prize.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Letterhead: "From E McKnight Kauffer 141 Swan Court Chelsea London SW3 Flaxman 0217"

controlaccess.corpname: Royal College of Art (Great Britain). Sketch Club

did.unittitle: E. McKnight Kauffer letter to Evelyn Hunt
did.physdesc: 1 sheet (1 page) : typed letter, signed ; 26 x 21 cm

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Kauffer accepts the invitation to act as adjudicator for the exhibition and asks for details regarding time.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Letterhead: "From E McKnight Kauffer 141 Swan Court Chelsea London SW3 Flaxman 0217"

controlaccess.corpname: Royal College of Art (Great Britain). Sketch Club

did.unittitle: E. McKnight Kauffer letter to Evelyn Hunt
did.physdesc: 1 sheet (1 page) : typed letter, signed ; 28 x 19 cm

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Kauffer confirms intention to see exhibit on Friday 19 in the afternoon.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Letterhead: "E. McKnight Kauffer Hon. R.D.I. 141 Swan Court Chelsea S.W.3 Flaxman 0217"

controlaccess.corpname: Royal College of Art (Great Britain). Sketch Club

did.unittitle: Alexander Korda letter to Margaret Kaye
did.physdesc: 1 sheet (1 page) : typed letter, signed ; 26 x 21 cm

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Korda expresses his gratitude for the offer to open the Students' Group exhibition but, as he will be away "for the purpose of making shots in a picture," he cannot accept.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Letterhead includes larger image of Big Ben, with "LONDON FILM" superimposed over top, as well as a list of directors involved in the company.

controlaccess.corpname: Royal College of Art (Great Britain). Sketch Club

did.unittitle: James Laver letter to Evelyn Hunt
did.physdesc: 1 sheet (1 page) : autograph letter, signed ; 12 x 19 cm

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Laver says he will gladly give a prize for "best theatrical costume" and asks about the exact amount.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Letterhead: "Victoria & Albert museum, South Kensington, S.W.7." Also "National Scheme for Disabled Men" stamp

controlaccess.corpname: Royal College of Art (Great Britain). Sketch Club

did.unittitle: James Laver letter to Evelyn Hunt
did.physdesc: 1 sheet (1 page) : typed letter, signed ; 24 x 19 cm

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Laver confirms a time to see the exhibit with Hunt.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Letterhead: "Department of Engraving, Illustration, & Design, Victoria & Albert Museum, South Kensington, London, S.W.7." Also "National Scheme for Disabled Men" stamp

controlaccess.corpname: Royal College of Art (Great Britain). Sketch Club

did.unittitle: Printed invitation to James Laver
did.physdesc: 1 card : 12 x 16 cm

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Printed invitation to Sketch Club Exhibition, "by P. Wyndham Lewis," with "James Laver Esq. & Friends" written in invitee field. Marginalia in pencil on back, various names matched with positions including secretary, chair, and treasurer; most unclear.

controlaccess.corpname: Royal College of Art (Great Britain). Sketch Club

did.unittitle: Vivien Lawson letter to Joseph Jago
did.physdesc: 1 folded sheet (4 pages) : autograph letter, signed ; 16 x 23 cm, folded to 16 x 12 cm

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Lawson says she is "always glad to do anything for the R.C.A Sketch Club" and offers one guinea, to use however the Committee wants, with a preference that a prize go to someone who hasn't received one. In a different hand at the bottom is written: "stout [?] fella". Also includes five graphite sketches of faces.

controlaccess.corpname: Royal College of Art (Great Britain). Sketch Club

did.unittitle: P. Wyndham Lewis letter to Frank B. Mason
did.physdesc: 1 sheet (1 page) : autograph letter, signed ; 26 x 21 cm

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Lewis accepts Mason's invitation to officiate at the opening of the exhibition, and asks that "before the time comes for doing my stuff you must explain the ritual to me of course!" He proposes further discussions and includes an address.

controlaccess.corpname: Royal College of Art (Great Britain). Sketch Club

did.unittitle: Eric Maclagan letter to Frank B. Mason
did.physdesc: 1 sheet (1 page) : typed letter, signed ; 24 x 19 cm

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Maclagan thanks Mason for his letter, and says the museum is always glad to assist the students of the RCA.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Letterhead: "Victoria & Albert Museum, South Kensington, London, S.W.7." with National Scheme for Disabled Men stamp

controlaccess.corpname: Royal College of Art (Great Britain). Sketch Club
Victoria and Albert Museum

did.unittitle: Eric Maclagan letter to J. Anthony Denney
did.physdesc: 1 sheet (2 pages) : typed letter, signed ; 24 x 19 cm

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Maclagan gives details of when the Students' Group may use space in the Victoria and Albert Museum, and provides conditions for the use of the space, namely that no work or responsibilities fall on museum staff; that work and showings happen during museum hours; and that sale of art is not permitted. He asks for the exact dates of the exhibition.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Letterhead: "Victoria & Albert Museum, South Kensington, London, S.W.7." with National Scheme for Disabled Men stamp

controlaccess.corpname: Royal College of Art (Great Britain). Sketch Club
Victoria and Albert Museum

did.unittitle: Eric Maclagan letter to Margaret Kaye
did.physdesc: 1 sheet (1 page) : typed letter, signed ; 24 x 19 cm

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Maclagan gives details of when the Students' Group may use space in the Victoria and Albert Museum, and provides conditions for the use of the space, namely that no work or responsibilities fall on museum staff; that work and showings happen during museum hours; and that sale of art is not permitted.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Letterhead: "Victoria & Albert Museum, South Kensington, London, S.W.7." with National Scheme for Disabled Men stamp

controlaccess.corpname: Royal College of Art (Great Britain). Sketch Club
Victoria and Albert Museum

did.unittitle: J. Young (secretary for Eric Maclagan) letter to Evelyn Hunt (?)
did.physdesc: 1 sheet (1 page) : typed letter, signed ; 25 x 20 cm

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Young conveys Maclagan's willingness to present a prize at the exhibition, as before.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Letterhead: "Victoria & Albert museum, South Kensington, S.W.7." Also "National Scheme for Disabled Men" stamp

scopecontent.p: Marlow agrees to give a prize for ceramics, and encloses a check for that purpose.

did.unittitle: Walter Nugent Monck letter to Frank B. Mason
did.physdesc: 1 sheet (1 page) : autograph letter, signed ; 21 x 13 cm

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Monck agree to provide a prize, and proposes one for a set design for Shakespeare's Comedy of Errors or a set design for The Merchant of Venice.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Letterhead: "The Maddermarket Theatre, Norwich (under the direction of Nugent Monck), Tel. Norwich 1360"

controlaccess.subject: Theaters -- Stage-setting and scenery
controlaccess.corpname: Royal College of Art (Great Britain). Sketch Club

did.unittitle: Walter Nugent Monck letter to Frank B. Mason
did.physdesc: 1 sheet (1 page) : autograph letter, signed ; 21 x 13 cm

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Monck regrets that he cannot attend the exhibition though suggests H. Vernon Gardner as an alternative judge. He includes his address, which is written again at the bottom of the letter, in pencil and in a different hand.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Letterhead: "The Maddermarket Theatre, Norwich (under the direction of Nugent Monck), Tel. Norwich 1360"

controlaccess.corpname: Royal College of Art (Great Britain). Sketch Club

did.unittitle: Walter Nugent Monck letter to J. Anthony Denney
did.physdesc: 1 sheet (1 page) : autograph letter, signed ; 26 x 21 cm

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Monck accepts Denney's invitation to sponsor another prize: "Last year I withheld my prize because none of the students had bothered to enter for the exact Shakespeare plays that I set. The object being that they should do as they are asked to do - as in life - not what they choose, which is seldom what is required of one. I will try once again. A set of designs for 'The Tempest' [...]."

odd.head: General
odd.p: Letterhead includes large design of a bird on a column, alongside "The Norwich Players" and reads "The Norwich Players, Under the direction of Nugent Monck, Maddermarket Theatre, Norwich, Telephone No. 1360"

controlaccess.subject: Theaters -- Stage-setting and scenery
controlaccess.corpname: Royal College of Art (Great Britain). Sketch Club

did.unittitle: B.L. Leary (secretary to Walter Nugent Monck) letter to unidentified recipient (probably J. Anthony Denney)
did.physdesc: 1 sheet (1 page) : typed letter, signed ; 26 x 21 cm

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Leary says that Monck would be glad to attend the judging and opening of the exhibition if he is in London.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Letterhead includes large design of a bird on a column, alongside "The Norwich Players" and reads "The Norwich Players, Under the direction of Nugent Monck, Maddermarket Theatre, Norwich, Telephone No. 1360"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Robertson says that Mortimer is on holiday, but she will bring Hunt's letter to his attention when he returns.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Letterhead: "The New Statesmen and Nation, The Weekend Review, 10 Great Turnstile, London, W.C.1, Holborn 3216"

did.physdesc: 1 sheet (1 page) : autograph letter, signed ; 26 x 21 cm

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Mortimer accepts Hunt's offer to adjudicate in the upcoming exhibition, "though I feel a certain shyness about it, as I am not a painter myself."

odd.head: General
odd.p: Letterhead: "The New Statesmen and Nation, The Weekend Review, 10 Great Turnstile, London, W.C.1, Holborn 3216"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Mortimer confirms a time to come see the paintings--"I want to see the paintings by daylight."

odd.head: General
odd.p: Letterhead: "The New Statesmen and Nation, The Weekend Review, 10 Great Turnstile, London, W.C.1, Holborn 3216"

did.physdesc: 1 sheet (1 page) : autograph letter, signed ; 22 x 18 cm

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Nash accepts the offer to judge at the exhibition and notes that he will be teaching at the Royal College of Art himself in October.

controlaccess.corpname: Royal College of Art (Great Britain). Sketch Club

did.unittitle: Fred P. Phillips letter to Frank B. Mason
did.physdesc: 1 sheet (1 page) : typed letter, signed ; 26 x 19 cm

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Phillips agrees to sponsor a prize as before, "the subject to be a Double Royal poster advertising ORIENT CRUISES to NORWAY or MEDITERRANEAN."

odd.head: General
odd.p: Letterhead includes orange image of a castle, and "Sanders Phillips & Co. LTD, The Baynard Press, Chryssell Road, London, S.W.9"

controlaccess.corpname: Royal College of Art (Great Britain). Sketch Club

did.unittitle: Fred P. Phillips letter to J. Anthony Denney
did.physdesc: 1 sheet (2 pages) : typed letter, signed ; 26 x 19 cm

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Phillips agrees to sponsor a prize as before, with the condition that it be withdrawn if less than twelve students submit. Marginalia on back.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Letterhead includes orange image of a castle, and "Sanders Phillips & Co. LTD, The Baynard Press, Chryssell Road, London, S.W.9"

controlaccess.corpname: Royal College of Art (Great Britain). Sketch Club

did.unittitle: G.R. Pope letter to Frank B. Mason (?)
did.physdesc: 1 sheet (2 pages) : typed letter, signed ; 26 x 21 cm

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Pope enquires about whether the Sketch Club plans to advertise for their upcoming exhibition: "It is, I am sure, unnecessary to remind you that readers of the 'Morning Post' are mostly people with money to spend, and a fair amount of leisure." Unrelated marginalia on back.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Letterhead: "The Morning Post, 15, Tudor Street, E.C.4, Telephone: Central 1500"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Raverat agrees to give a guinea as a prize, though "it is not a precedent for ever!" She also agrees to come to see the show to pick a winner for the prize.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Letterhead: "Harlton Near Cambridge, Telephone Harston 274"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Read writes to let Denney know he is ill, and will likely not be able to fulfill his role for the exhibition, though he discusses the possibility of postponement.

did.unittitle: Herbert Read letter to Evelyn Hunt
did.physdesc: 1 sheet (1 page) : typed letter, signed ; 26 x 21 cm

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Read explains he has no knowledge of photography, and that he thinks Hunt should find another candidate to judge at the exhibit, though he agrees to serve if she can find no one else.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Letterhead: "3 The Mall Parkhill Road London NW3"

did.unittitle: Edward Robinson letter to Margaret Kaye (?)
did.physdesc: 2 sheets (2 pages) : typed letters, signed ; 26 x 21 cm

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Robinson's secretary, in a cover letter, apologizes for a letter which "went astray in the post." A copy of that letter is enclosed--in it, Robison regrets he will be back in America at the time of the exhibition.

did.physdesc: 1 sheet (1 page) : typed letter, signed ; 21 x 21 cm

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Rutherston encloses a check and discusses possible times to come judge his portion of the show. He further asks that he might no longer be included on the list of prize givers, as he feels he should devote any money to his own students.

odd.head: General

controlaccess.corpname: Royal College of Art (Great Britain). Sketch Club

did.unittitle: Hubert Wellington letter to Evelyn Hunt
did.physdesc: 1 sheet (1 page) : autograph letter, signed ; 26 x 21 cm

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Wellington agrees to continue his prize and, as he will not be in London for the show, suggests John Nash as a suitable judge. He also says he must stop sponsoring a prize after this year given his growing duties at his college.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Letterhead includes image of castle (presumably seal of Edinburgh College of Art) and: "The Edinburgh College of Art, Lauriston Place, Edinburgh.3. Telephone No. 32471"

did.unittitle: R.H. Wilenski letter to Frank B. Mason
did.physdesc: 1 sheet (1 page) : typed letter, signed ; 16 x 21 cm

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Wilenski suggests he should be free to judge for the show, but "as regards the prize I do not quite understand what you want me to do." He requests a further discussion.

scopecontent.p: Willcock informs Denney that the North Court of the V&A Museum has been reserved for the RCA Sketch Club.

controlaccess.corpname: Royal College of Art (Great Britain). Sketch Club
Victoria and Albert Museum

did.unittitle: Note by an unidentified author on costumes and settings for a contemporary play
did.physdesc: 1 sheet (1 page) ; 19 x 12 cm

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A short note written in graphite: "Sketch Club. Costumes and settings for a contemporary play." A different hand has appended the words "mine" (pointing to "costumes") and "Bawden's" (pointing to "settings"). In a third hand, the foot is annotated with the words "Bawden + Ravilious" -- i.e., Edward Bawden and Eric Ravilious.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Letterhead: "Royal College of Art, South Kensington, London, S.W.7."
